laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild Ebstein’s anomaly with moderate tricuspid valve insufficiency and right heart enlargement, atrial septal defect, membranous VSD, and LVNC.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 3 years of follow-up, the patient is doing well, with normal growth and development, but continues to have echocardiographic features of LVNC with abnormal myocardial relaxation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild Ebstein’s anomaly, VSD, and LVNC.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient is now aged 1 year and in good health. Cardiac function has steadily improved to reach a left ventricular ejection fraction of approximately 60%, but continues to have echocardiographic features of LVNC with abnormal myocardial relaxation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Hypertrophied right ventricle and secondary tricuspid regurgitation with a systolic gradient of 100 mm Hg. LV internal dimension in diastole of 22 mm; mean diastolic gradient across minimal regurgitant mitral valve of 8 mm Hg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient could be discharged home on postoperative day 21 under medical treatment with bosentan and sildenaﬁl. After an uneventful period of 4 months without any PH crises, the patient was seen in improved clinical condition.
